glsa.title: OpenSSL: Alternate chains certificate forgery
glsa.synopsis: Certain checks on untrusted certificates can be bypassed.

background.p: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.

description.p: During certificate verification, OpenSSL attempts to find an alternative certificate chain if the first attempt to build such a chain fails.

impact.p: A remote attacker could cause certain checks on untrusted certificates to be bypassed, such as the CA flag, enabling them to use a valid leaf certificate to act as a CA and “issue” an invalid certificate.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
